Context:
The text provides information about Academic Upgrading programs offered at George Brown College. These programs are designed to help adults improve their skills in reading, writing, math, and science, with a focus on meeting college and apprenticeship entry requirements in English Communications, math, and science. Courses are offered both in-person and online, and different levels of English and math are available up to the Academic and Career Entrance (ACE) level. Science courses are offered at the ACE level only. ACE credits are recognized by Ontario colleges for application to postsecondary and apprenticeship programs, and many employers also recognize the ACE Certificate.

Academic Upgrading courses take varying lengths of time to complete, depending on personal goals, academic needs, and progress, with some taking as little as 4 months and others lasting longer than a year. The text provides contact information for obtaining more information: upgradinginfo@georgebrown.ca or 416-415-5000 ext. 3560. Additionally, there is a free one-week program called CHOICES that helps individuals learn about themselves and set goals for the future.

Therefore, the extracted information includes:

* George Brown College offers Academic Upgrading programs to help adults improve skills and meet college entry requirements.
* Courses offered in English, math, and science at varying levels up to ACE (Academic and Career Entrance).
* Science courses available only at the ACE level.
* ACE credits recognized by Ontario colleges for application to postsecondary and apprenticeship programs.
* Many employers recognize the ACE Certificate.
* Academic Upgrading courses take varying lengths of time, from 4 months to over a year.
* Contact information for obtaining more information: upgradinginfo@georgebrown.ca or 415-5000 ext. 3560.
* There is also a free one-week program called CHOICES that helps individuals learn about themselves and set goals for the future.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Academic Upgrading FAQ | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* Eligibility for Deaf/Hard-of-Hearing Academic Upgrading: Age 19 or older, know some ASL and live in Ontario.
* Email address for information about Deaf/Hard-of-Hearing Academuping: deafupgrading@georgebrown.ca
* Website for Deaf Learning Now: Not provided in text
* EI benefits may not be available during academic upgrading, contact Service Canada for clarification.
* All Academic Upgrading courses are tuition-free for permanent residents of Ontario and funded by Employment Ontario. There is a fee for some ACE Distance courses depending on when taken.
* Students in the Academic Upgrading Program and Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing Upgrading Program can apply for transportation subsidies.
* Equivalent credential through Academic Upgrading: ACE (Academic Career Entrance) Certificate by completing 4 ACE level credits.
* Contact information for Academic Upgrading Info: upgradinginfo@georgebrown.ca, 416-415-5000 ext. 3560.
* Land acknowledgment and sign up for college news and updates available on the website but no specific details provided in text.
* Phone number for general inquiries: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559
* Email address for general inquiries: ask.george@georgebrown.
